description.en: This introductory course is meant for students interested in space technology and space research. The course gives and overview of the history of space exploration in the World and in Estonia, as well as future perspectives. Most important space technology components, instruments and their work principles are presented. Both peaceful and military use of space applications are discussed. During the course, students will design their own mission.
description.et: Käesolev sissejuhatav kursus on mõeldud kosmoseuuringute temaatikast huvitatud üliõpilastele. Kursuse käigus antakse ülevaade maailmas ja ka Eestis läbiviidud kosmoseuuringute ajaloost ning tulevikuperspektiividest. Tutvustatakse tähtsamaid kasutatavaid seadmeid, mõõtevahendeid ja nende tööpõhimõtteid. Antakse ülevaade kosmose rahumeelsetest ja ka sõjalistest rakendustest.

objectives.en: The aims of the course are:
- to raise the competence of Estonian industry and scientific institutes in the field of space technology by introducing this topic to the future workforce;
objectives.et: - tõsta eesti tööstuse ja teaduse võimekust kosmosetehnoloogia valdkonnas ettevõtetesse tööleasuvatele spetsialistidele antud valdkonna tutvustamise kaudu;

objectives.en: - to explain and popularize the field of space research, European Space Agency space programmes and the role of Estonian membership.
objectives.et: - kosmoseuuringute ning nende rakenduste, Euroopa Liidu kosmoseprogrammide ja Eesti osalusvõimaluste selgitamine ja populariseerimine.

learning_outcomes.en: At the end of the course the participants will be able to:
- recall the capabilities of Tartu Observatory Space Technology Department/Labs
learning_outcomes.et: - meenutada Tartu observatooriumi kosmosetehnoloogia osakonna ja laborite võimekusi;

learning_outcomes.en: - describe the different opportunities to continue on in the space field in Estonia and ESA
learning_outcomes.et: - kirjeldada erinevaid võimalusi kosmose valdkonnas Eestis ja ESAs;

learning_outcomes.en: - explain why we should do space research
learning_outcomes.et: - selgitada miks me peaksime kosmost uurima;

learning_outcomes.en: - describe how Estonia fits into the space race
- create value as a team member
- collaboratively develop a solution based on requirements
learning_outcomes.et: - luua nõuetele vastava lahenduse koostöös teistega;

learning_outcomes.en: - describe the usefulness of ECSS and standards in general
learning_outcomes.et: - kirjeldada ECSSi ja üldiselt standardite kasulikkust;

learning_outcomes.en: - identify and describe space mission phases
- relate new knowledge to past experience
- recall the fundamental physical concepts governing missions in space
learning_outcomes.et: - meenutada fundamentaalseid füüsikalisi mõisteid, millest kosmosemissioonid sõltuvad;

learning_outcomes.en: - make logical guesses with limited knowledge
- analyse space missions and critique them on a basic level
learning_outcomes.et: - analüüsida kosmosemissioone ja neid algtasemel arvustada.

debt_elimination.et:
It is possible to retake the final exam one time near the end of the semester.
The deadline for the retaking of the exam is the start of the next semester.
With the approval of the dean, it is possible to apply for a two week extension to the exam deadline.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: Materials will be available on Moodle.
resources.recommended_materials: During the course, student groups will chose a course project topic and the literature will depend on the topic.
